page.title: 05Life in Easington Colliery
page.content: Alyson wrote - Easington is not a place for youth. It is spoiled by unemployment. As the future of the pit is uncertain the colliery is not taking on any school leavers. Easington is a close knit community. During the long strike everybody was helping each other. There are 5 churches in Easington Colliery though there are very few parishoners. Tristan is a choir boy at the local parish church. He wrote "being a choir boy is quite nice and I enjoy singing. I have earned my second medal, a dark blue one. On Sundays I lead the choir into church with a cross. When our choir master left I was upset because he took the choir over to Durham Cathedral. We are having a new central heating system put into our church.
